sentence.Network_en: Saying she's improved comes over as a backhanded compliment.
sentence.Network_cn: 说她进步了听起来倒像是一种讽刺。

sentence.Network_en: "Even my good reviews have tended to be backhanded compliments," he says. "They'll say I was good and almost unbearably grotesque."
sentence.Network_cn: “即便赞扬我的评论也多似明褒实贬，”他说。“他们会说我的表演不错，荒诞得几乎让人接受不了。”

sentence.Network_en: In a backhanded way, I think a lot of my energy and strength comes from my campaigning.
sentence.Network_cn: 我觉得我的活力和力量很多都间接来自于我的竞选运动。

entry.tran: 隐含讥讽的；有言外之意的
entry.def: A backhanded compliment is a remark which seems to be an insult but could also be understood as a compliment. A backhanded compliment is also a remark which seems to be a compliment but could also be understood as an insult.

example.ex: 'Even my good reviews have tended to be backhanded compliments,' he says. 'They'll say I was good and almost unbearably grotesque.'...
example.tran: “即便赞扬我的评论也多似明褒实贬，”他说。“他们会说我的表演不错，荒诞得几乎让人接受不了。”

example.ex: Saying she's improved comes over as a backhanded compliment.
example.tran: 说她进步了听起来倒像是一种讽刺。

entry.def: If you say that someone is doing something in a backhanded way, they are doing it indirectly.

example.ex: In a backhanded way, I think a lot of my energy and strength comes from my campaigning.
example.tran: 我觉得我的活力和力量很多都间接来自于我的竞选运动。

means.word_mean: 1. (of racket strokes) made across the body with back of hand facing direction of stroke
